pullRequest.title: FAI-250: [trusty-ui]: Move to kogito-tooling 0.6.1
pullRequest.bodyText:
See https://issues.redhat.com/browse/FAI-250
Many thanks for submitting your Pull Request ❤️!
Please make sure that your PR meets the following requirements:

 You have read the contributors guide
 Pull Request title is properly formatted: KOGITO-XYZ Subject
 Pull Request title contains the target branch if not targeting master: [0.9.x] KOGITO-XYZ Subject
 Pull Request contains link to the JIRA issue
 Pull Request contains link to any dependent or related Pull Request
 Pull Request contains description of the issue
 Pull Request does not include fixes for issues other than the main ticket

nodes.bodyText:
I should be able to copy the envelope HTML and JS from @kogito-tooling/kie-bc-editors.
I was going to add the PMML editor factory here too; but it's probably best I make a quick and easy "host" for the new editor until it's at a stage to be re-used in kogito's channels (including trusty). I'll update this PR... converting to draft.

+      message: EnvelopeBusMessage<D, Type>,
+      targetOrigin?: string,
+      _?: any
+    ) {
+      window.parent.postMessage(message, '*', _);
+    }
+  },
+  editorFactory: new EditorEnvelope.CompositeEditorFactory([

nodes.bodyText:
I see you're setting up a context for i18n using the setup provided by kogito-tooling.
I suppose the idea is to use it for the whole trusty app? I thought i18n could deserve a separate PR. Unless you cannot do without it with the editors.
Why are you adding chunks configuration?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -15,7 +15,8 @@ module.exports = {
   plugins: [
     new HtmlWebpackPlugin({
       template: path.resolve(__dirname, 'src', 'index.html'),
-      favicon: 'src/favicon.ico'
+      favicon: 'src/favicon.ico',
+      chunks: ['app']

nodes.bodyText:
I think it's a good idea if we use some kind of "rules" for sorting imports. Like app-wide requirements on top (react, routing etc), external components (patternfly or similar) and internal stuff (ui components, types etc.).
What do you think? (I'm not saying I always ordered things properly but I try 😬)
I don't know if you changed the order manually of if it was your IDE.
I think there are also ESLint rules that auto sort imports that we could use once we migrate to it.

beforeCommit.message: Add basic support for using kogito-tooling i18n.
